description: This course introduces the student to problems in high-level marketing decision making with several strategic marketing planning frameworks frequently applied during the analysis of those problems. The course will focus on a variety of management problems, which include the following characteristics: (1) several strategic units are involved in the decision; (2) competitors' behaviors are formally taken into account; (3) long-term marketing advantages are sought; (4) profit and other financial consequences are considered. Lectures, discussions, and case studies are used to convey the curriculum.
name: MARKETING STRATEGY
